news.title: Why So Many Insurers Are Leaving Obamacare
news.summary: One of the most common reasons critics of Obamacare say the law is “collapsing” is that insurers appear to be fleeing the Affordable Care Act’s health-insurance exchanges, or the state-based, online marketplaces where people can buy individual health…

news.title: Protected But Priced Out: Patients Worry About Health Law's Future In Arizona
news.summary: Corinne Bobbie (left) says she's grateful that the Affordable Care Act guaranteed health insurance for her 8-year-old daughter Sophia, who was born with an expensive heart condition.

news.title: Protected But Priced Out: Patients Worry About Health Law's Future In Arizona
news.summary: Corinne Bobbie (left) says she's grateful that the Affordable Care Act guaranteed health insurance for her 8-year-old daughter Sophia, who was born with an expensive heart condition.

news.title: Protected But Priced Out: Patients Worry About Health Law's Future In Arizona
news.summary: For years, says Corinne Bobbie, shopping in Arizona for a health plan for her little girl went like this: " 'Sorry, we're not covering that kid," Bobbie recalls insurers telling her.

news.title: Big Week Ahead For Insurers As Trump Weighs Obamacare Subsidies
news.summary: If she is to be believed, Kellyanne Conway says her boss will announce this week whether cost-sharing subsidies will be funded to help pay out-of-pocket costs of those buying coverage under the Affordable Care Act.

news.title: GOP Leans Toward Funding Obamacare Subsidies With A Catch
news.summary: Republican members of Congress seem to be leaning more toward a legislative solution to funding cost-sharing subsidies under the Affordable Care Act to stabilize the individual insurance market.

news.title: Ohio insurers seek up to 41 percent premium hikes if Trump yanks federal Obamacare subsidies
news.summary: WASHINGTON -- Ohio insurers in the Affordable Care Act market are filing new, substantially higher premium requests -- with average hikes up to 41 percent -- in case President Donald Trump pulls the plug on federal money promised by President Obama.

news.title: Ohio insurers seek up to 48 percent premium hikes if Trump yanks federal Obamacare subsidies
news.summary: WASHINGTON -- Ohio insurers in the Affordable Care Act market are filing new, substantially higher premium requests -- with average hikes up to 41 percent -- in case President Donald Trump pulls the plug on federal money promised by President Obama.

news.title: Ohio insurers seek up to 41 percent premium hikes if Trump yanks federal Obamacare subsidies
news.summary: WASHINGTON — Ohio insurers in the Affordable Care Act market are filing new, substantially higher premium requests — with average hikes up to 41 percent — in case President Donald Trump pulls the plug on federal money promised by President Obama.
